☻ Bio Work Notes

Hi there, I'm Steven Trevathan.

You may know me as a product designer, developer, entrepreneur, photographer, musician, or maybe a friend.

Life

My interest in technology began as it has for many people born in the 80s. I was eleven years old when we inherited our first computer, which, through happenstance, quickly became mine. I was fixated. Not long after, I was able to buy my own food for a summer by designing and developing a website for an ice skate retailer in my hometown. A few years later I was picked by my high school's IT shop instructors to work in a local print shop to manage their website design and development, edit their book covers, and to oft times cover or assist other print shop personnel running the presses.

I am grateful for these experiences.

After the print shop, I pursued my degree in graphic design and photography while running a small painting business to support myself. This period of my life was marked by a strong drive and a willingness to experiment, which quickly opened doors for me in my professional journey. I've had the opportunity to join and create many successful product teams as a founder, director, manager, product designer, and developer. I come with a very rich background and an enthuasiastic commitment to skill development and making meaningful contributions to our ever-improving world.

Hobbies & Family History

I perform the marimba, guitar, drums, keyboards, vocals, and write all of my music. I love musical absurdity, comedy, and poetry.
I am also a photographer, a dog trainer, a runner, a health and fitness enthusiast, and lover of strategy games.

My grandfather was an awarded US Air Force Wartime Navigator who served in WWII and also the inventor of the honeycomb - a fuel efficiency cell designed to ensure astronauts would have the fuel to return home from the moon. His prototype was installed on Apollo 11. While I inherited zero of his mechanical engineering skills, that creative mechanical thinking runs in the family. I have ambition, experience, patience, a legacy I cherish (though I promise the heritage brags end right here), and I'm excited to bring my best to my next project.

Career

Founder & CEO, Make&Model

2017 - Present

As the Founder and CEO of Make&Model, I hired and spearheaded our team in our work executing on innovative projects across various domains, notably achieving an Emmy award for one of our clients and leading many through critical growth phases. I'm a leader who cares deeply about personal creative development, growth, and in fostering innovation and collaboration across teams. I founded this services firm to focus on mission-driven work, and pairing that with my background in product lead us to have many opportunities to work on critical and innovative challenges bringing positive change to both society and the environment.

Director of Design, Mariana Tek

2016 - 2017

After working with the founders of Flywheel Sports - a former top competitive spin cycling studio with locations around the world - to redefine critical technical and service design aspects of their customer experience, I'd find myself working with the same team on their new venture. My first mark was to run a sequence of design sprints that would become the first phase of their product, and I'd later join the team full time as their Director of Design. During my time there I directly contributed on product design, user research, usability testing, and paved the way forward for this new team to bring the product to an international market.

Partner & Creative Director, DockYard

2013 - 2016

In 2013, only a year later after starting Dobot, I sold it to DockYard and onboarded as Partner and Creative Director. I would eventually co-lead a team of nine designers and twelve engineers. We completed multi-million dollar projects for clients like McGraw Hill Education, NASDAQ, Society of Grownups/Mass Mutual, IDEO, Flywheel Sports, and America's Test Kitchen. After overseeing the team expansion and training my successor, I resigned to embark on a journey to explore the concept of a impact driven design studio, which eventually materialized as Make&Model.

Founder, Dobot

2012 - 2013

My second business was a Cambridge, MA-based boutique design and illustration studio. I led the creation of interactive animated web comics, organized pillar Boston design community events, and art-directed animations, photoshoots, and even music videos. While we focused largely on full interactive media experiences, we also performed product design services ranging from innovative in-store shopping to software for new wifi-first cellular devices.

Sr. Designer & Front-end Developer, CustomMade

2010 - 2012

As the sole designer and front-end developer, I rapidly designed and launched features in weekly sprints, focusing on iteration and delivery. I'd design the feature in the first two days, then deliver the functional experience over the remainder of the week. This experience significantly enhanced my skills in product team collaboration, understanding trade-offs, patience, and determination. I wouldn't recommend folks maintain such a tight timeline for every release, however utilizing the method as spikes on critical areas can be immensely helpful.

Sr. Designer & Front-end Developer, Fuzz Productions

2008 - 2010

In my first post-college design role, I worked extensively, laying the groundwork for my career in design, development, and entrepreneurship. At Fuzz, I designed notable iPhone apps for Cond√© Nast and the pioneering UGuideMe tour guide system. My responsibilities included redesigning and developing websites for banks, schools, and artists, along with managing client relations. This role tested everything I thought I knew, but my background in print and information technology equipped me to handle the challenging trade-offs and client negotiations.

Education

  • Diploma, Information Technology - 2004 Pathfinder R.V.T.H.S. Awards: Excellence in Geometry, Physics, and Information Technology
